means: （使）弯曲，屈身(bend的过去式和过去分词)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 本特地貌名称，来源于古英语，含义是“小糠草”(bent grass)

sentence.Network_en: Then she bent over and gave him an eyeful of her tattoos.
sentence.Network_cn: 接着她弯下身子，让他好好看清楚她的文身。

sentence.Network_en: Everyone in the room was bent over her desk.
sentence.Network_cn: 房间里的每一个人都弯腰围在她的办公室桌前。

sentence.Network_en: She was bent over the sink washing the dishes.

jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美，非正式)愤怒的；焦躁不安的

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Old English  beonet (recorded in place names), of West Germanic origin; related to German Binse

entry.def: Bent is the past tense and past participle of bend .
If an object is bent, it is damaged and no longer has its correct shape.

example.ex: The trees were all bent and twisted from the wind.

entry.def: If a person is bent, their body has become curved because of old age or disease.

entry.tran: （尤指做不好的事情）决意的，下定决心的
entry.def: If someone is bent on doing something, especially something harmful, they are determined to do it.
If you have a bent for something, you have a natural ability to do it or a natural interest in it.

example.ex: His bent for natural history directed him towards his first job.
example.tran: 他选择第一份工作是出自对博物学的热爱。

entry.def: If someone is of a particular bent, they hold a particular set of beliefs.

example.tran: 信仰社会主义的经济学家

entry.tran: （官员等）不正直的，贪赃枉法的
entry.def: If you say that someone in a position of responsibility is bent, you mean that they are dishonest or do illegal things.

entry.tran: 同性恋的（可能具冒犯意味）
entry.def: Homosexuals are sometimes described as bent. This use could cause offence.

entry.tran: （疼或笑得）弯了腰，直不起腰（美国英语中亦用 bent over double）
entry.def: If someone is bent double, the top part of their body is leaning forward towards their legs, usually because they are in great pain or because they are laughing a lot. In American English, you can also say that someone is bent over double.

example.ex: He left the courtroom on the first day bent double with stomach pain.
example.tran: 第一天他就因胃痛得直不起腰而离开了法庭。

means.word_mean: 1. a relatively permanent inclination to react in a particular way;

sentences.sentence: "the set of his mind was obvious"

means.word_mean: 2. grass for pastures and lawns especially bowling and putting greens
3. a special way of doing something;

sentences.sentence: "he had a special knack for getting into trouble"
"he couldn't get the hang of it"

means.word_mean: 1. altered from an originally straight condition;
3. used of the back and knees; stooped;
4. used especially of the head or upper back;

sentences.sentence: "a car with a crumpled front end"

list.explanation: 非常生气的，十分烦恼的

example.en: Man, there is no reason to get so bent out of shape. I didn't mean any harm.
example.zh: 老兄,你没有理由要发这么大的火。我没有任何恶意。

example.en: I got bent out of shape because of maltreatment I received.
example.zh: 我因为受到了虐待而感到很气愤。

example.en: I was so bent out of shape I thought I'd never recover.
example.zh: 兴时我喝得烂醉如泥，以为自己永远也醍不过来了。

auth_sentence.content: I just happen to have a more abstract bent.

auth_sentence.content: I bent and washed my hands in the river.
auth_sentence.res_content: I bent and washed my hands in the river.

sentences.en: He has a bent for music.
